constraint.Message: WFPC2 filter other than DEF cannot be specified for BIAS, DARK and KSPOTS
WFPC2 BIAS must be given an exposure time of zero
WFPC2 exposure time must be greater than 1 second when CLOCKS=YES
WFPC2 READ optional parameter values other than YES or NO are engineering only
WFPC2 exposures with LRF as a spectral element must also have LRF as the Aperture
WFPC2 exposures with Aperture LRF must also have LRF as a spectral element
WFPC2 exposures in AFM or POM Mode must specify target NONE
Spectral Element F605W cannot be specified with FGS2
Spectral Element F650W can only be specified with FGS2
FGS DARK target is only available with POS Mode
FGS LOS Mode must be 47 seconds long.
DARK is only valid for ACCUM, and MULTIACCUM
Spectral element must be BLANK with DARK target
ALIGN exposures must have target NONE
All MULTIACCUM exposures must have an exposure time of DEF. The last SAMP-TIME optional parameter or the sequence chosen with SAMP-SEQ and NSAMP will determine the exposure time.

NICMOS ACCUM exps with READOUT=FAST and NREAD=10 are only calibrated for the following exp times 10.1 12.1 14.9 17.8 23.1 30.9 45.6 63.3 88.9 116.0 165.0 235.0 366.0 486.0 582.0 966.0 1208.0 1452.0 1866.0 2706.0 3606.0
You may not use SAMP-SEQ and SAMP-TIME<n> optional parameters together. They are mutually exclusive. Use SAMP-SEQ and NSAMP, OR, fill out the desired number of SAMP-TIME<n> entries.
You may not use NSAMP and SAMP-TIME<n> optional parameters together. They are mutually exclusive. Use SAMP-SEQ and NSAMP, OR, fill out the desired number of SAMP-TIME<n> entries.
You must supply both SAMP-SEQ and NSAMP together. Or, supply only SAMP-TIME<n> optional parameters.
SAMP-SEQ is incompatible with READOUT=SLOW.
NIC NREAD values other than 1 or 9 are available-level only values.
Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEF or 1-2 is legal only with NIC1, NIC1-FIX, NIC2, or NIC2-FIX Apertures.
When Config = NIC1 and Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEFOCUS then the Aperture must be NIC1-FIXD.
When Config = NIC1 and the Aperture is NIC1-FIXD then the Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEFOCUS must be supplied
When Config = NIC2 and Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEFOCUS then the Aperture must be NIC2-FIXD.
When Config = NIC2 and the Aperture is NIC2-FIXD then the Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEFOCUS must be supplied
When Config = NIC3 and Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEFOCUS then the Aperture must be NIC3-FIXD.
When Config = NIC3 and the Aperture is NIC3-FIXD then the Optional parameter CAMERA-FOCUS = DEFOCUS must be supplied
STIS Optional Parameter(s) SIZEAXIS1, SIZEAXIS2, CENTERAXIS1 and CENTERAXIS2 are invalid for Config FUV-MAMA
STIS Optional Parameter(s) SIZEAXIS1, SIZEAXIS2, CENTERAXIS1 and CENTERAXIS2 are invalid for Config NUV-MAMA
STIS/CCD Optional Parameter POS is invalid for Mode ACCUM, Spectral Element G430M
STIS/CCD Optional Parameter POS is invalid for Mode ACCUM, Spectral Element MIRROR
STIS/FUV-MAMA Optional Parameter POS is invalid for Mode ACCUM, Spectral Element G140L
Must use MIRROR spectral element to perform a subarray smaller than 30.
Must use MIRROR spectral element to perform a subarray smaller than 30.
Must use MIRROR spectral element to perform a subarray smaller than 30.
Must use MIRROR spectral element to perform a subarray smaller than 30.
Must use MIRROR spectral element to perform a subarray smaller than 30.
Must use MIRROR spectral element to perform a subarray smaller than 30.
Lamps except TUNGSTEN not allowed in non-engineering proposals.
Calibration Target 'NONE' only allowed in engineering proposals unless LAMP is TUNGSTEN
Calibration Target 'NONE' only allowed in engineering proposals unless LAMP is TUNGSTEN
Spectral Element must be specified. Legal Apertures are dependent on the Spectral Element and all Apertures are illegal until a Spectral Element is selected.
EARTH-CALIB is not allowed with STIS/FUV-MAMA or STIS/NUV-MAMA configuration.
Calibration Target BIAS and CCDFLAT can only be used with Config STIS/CCD.
DARK and BIAS are engineering only
WAVE and CCDFLAT targets are only allowed in ACCUM Mode.
You can not use MIRROR, X140H, X140M, X230H, or X230M spectral elements when using the WAVE calibration target.
STIS BIAS must be given an exposure time of zero
Exposure time must be DEF for MSMOFF exposures
Only a subset of the Apertures available to the G spectral elements are allowed for CCDFLATs.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
This spectral type is not valid for WAVE targets.
CCDFLAT exposures can only use the G750L and G750M filters.
KRYPTON is an illegal value for LAMP with STIS/CCD
TUNGSTEN is an illegal value for LAMP with STIS/FUV-MAMA and STIS/NUV-MAMA
SIZEAXIS1 is an available-level optional parameter in MAMA ACCUM or TIME-TAG Mode, unless you use the MIRROR or PRISM spectral elements.
CENTERAXIS2 is an available-level optional parameter in MAMA ACCUM or TIME-TAGE Modes, unless you use the echelle spectral elements (E140M, E140H, E230M, E230H).
No target is allowed with LAMPs
No target is allowed with SLIT-STEP
SLIT-STEP is only allowed when the LAMP optional parameter is either KRYPTON, DEUTERIUM, or TUNGSTEN.
SLIT-STEP is only allowed if the LAMP optional parameter is also used, where LAMP must be either KRYPTON, DEUTERIUM, or TUNGSTEN.
When Configuration is STIS/CCD, STIS/FUV-MAMA, STIS/NUV-MAMA, Mode is ACCUM, and Target is NONE you must supply the LAMP optional Parameter.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP HITM1 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP HITM1 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP HITM1/2 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP HITM1/2 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP must be HITM1 when used with PRISM.
LAMP HITM1 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP LINE is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP HITM1 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
LAMP HITM2 is not a valid parameter for this configuration.
STIS TIME-TAG Mode must have a BUFFER-TIME optional parameter
ALIGN, ANNEAL and MSMOFF exposures must have target NONE
Binning and subarray optional parameters are mutually exclusive
No optional parameters other than BINAXIS1 and BINAXIS2 are allowed with CCDFLAT targets.
DIFFUSE-CENTER and CHECKBOX optional parameters are only legal with ACQTYPE DIFFUSE
CHECKBOX must be specified with ACQTYPE DIFFUSE
DIFFUSE-CENTER must be specified with ACQTYPE DIFFUSE
DIFFUSE-CENTER can only be specified if ACQTYPE DIFFUSE
CHECKBOX can only be specified if ACQTYPE DIFFUSE
GAIN optional parameter only has SUPPORTED values of 1 and 4.
STIS ACQ exposures must be less than 5 minutes in a GO proposal.
STIS/CCD with target DARK or BIAS must specify spectral element DEF.
STIS/CCD with target DARK or BIAS must specify Aperture DEF.
STIS/FUV-MAMA and STIS/NUV-MAMA with target DARK must specify Aperture DEF.
STIS/FUV-MAMA and STIS/NUV-MAMA with target DARK must specify spectral element DEF.
Only target NONE is allowed with config STIS.
EARTH-CALIB is not allowed with the STIS/CCD configuration.
FLASH cannot be specified with FLASHEXP.
FLASH cannot be specified with FLASHCUR.
FLASH, FLASHEXP and FLASHCUR cannot be specified with the BIAS internal target.
If FLASHCUR is specified, FLASHEXP must also be specified.
If FLASHEXP is specified, FLASHCUR must also be specified.
For WFC3/UVIS ACCUM exposures in Available Mode, INJECT can only be NONE or YES.
BLADE B is a restricted value for WFC3/UVIS ACCUM
IRTEMP must be specified for WFC3 ANNEAL Mode.
WFC3 QUAD filters may only be used with the UVIS-QUAD, UVIS-QUAD-FIX or UVIS-QUAD-SUB Aperture.
WFC3 spectral element G280 must specify Aperture UVIS.
WFC3 spectral element G102/G141 may specify Aperture IR or IRSUB* or GRISM* but may not specifiy IRSUB*-FIX
WFC3 Apertures IR and IRSUB* are only allowed for G102/G141 in Available Mode.
On WFC3, the value of 8 for the GAIN optional parameter is an engineering-only setting.
On WFC3, the value of 16 for the GAIN optional parameter is an engineering-only setting.
WFC3 exposures must not be longer than 3600 seconds.
WFC3/UVIS DARK and BIAS Targets must specify DEF for the Spectral Element.
WFC3/UVIS ACCUM Mode exposures for target BIAS must use an exposure time of zero.
CR-SPLIT must be NO or not specified on an internal exposure.
BLADE may not be specified for the DARK, DARK-NM or BIAS internal targets.
CTE Can't be used with a DEUTERIUM or BIAS targets.
Aperture=UVIS is required when CTE=EPER.
Only the GAIN optional Parameter can be used when CTE=EPER.
WFC3 ALIGN exposures must have target NONE
Spectral element must be BLANK with DARK or DARK-NM target
Calibration Targets BIAS and DEUTERIUM can only be used with Config WFC3/UVIS.
CURRENT optional parameter must specify DEUTERIUM as the target.
Target must be NONE for WFC3 ANNEAL Mode.
All MULTIACCUM exposures must have an exposure time of DEF. The sequence chosen with SAMP-SEQ and NSAMP will determine the exposure time.
You must specify NSAMP when using MULTIACCUM Mode.
You must specify SAMP-SEQ when using MULTIACCUM Mode.
MIF* SAMP-SEQs are Available but Unsupported.
SPARS10 SAMP-SEQ is Available but Unsupported for some IRSUB and GRISM Apertures.
SPARS25 SAMP-SEQs is Available but Unsupported for some IRSUB and GRISM Apertures.
STEP25 SAMP-SEQ is Available but Unsupported for some IRSUB and GRISM Apertures.
SPARS50-200, and STEP50-400 SAMP-SEQs are Available but Unsupported for all IRSUB and GRISM subApertures.
WFC3 ALIGN exposures must be greater than 0.0 seconds.
SIZEAXIS1 may not be specified if Aperture is a Subarray Aperture.
SIZEAXIS2 may not be specified if Aperture is a Subarray Aperture.
CENTERAXIS1 may only be specified if SIZEAXIS1 is specifed.
CENTERAXIS2 may only be specified if SIZEAXIS2 is specifed.
CENTERAXIS2 should be between 9 and 2043 inclusive or between 2059 and 4093 inclusive or TARGET.
Only target NONE is allowed with config WFC3.
SCAN-SIZE=2 is not allowed with CENTER=FLUX-WT-FLR for COS ACQ/SEARCH
COS ACQ/SEARCH Mode must have a SCAN-SIZE optional parameter
COS FLASH may not be specified on an internal target
COS FLASH when used with WAVE is Restricted.
COS FLASH cannot be used with BOA Aperture.
Values other than YES and NO are Restricted for COS FLASH.
LOCAL-THRESHOLD is not allowed when CENTER=BRIGHTEST
COS ACQ/* exposures must be less than 6500 seconds.
COS exposures must be greater than 0.0 seconds.
COS exposures in the specified Mode must be greater than 0.1 seconds.
All COS TIME-TAG exposures must have an exposure time of DEF for Target Name = WAVE.
COS DARK Targets must specify DEF for the Spectral Element.
Specification of Wavelength is required with the specified spectral element.
Specification of Wavelength is not allowed with the MIRRORs.
The selected Spectral Element is illegal for this configuration when the target is Deuterium.
FORMAT special requirement should not be used with COS
The COS requires telemetry through the engineering data channel. Therefore, additional telemetry cannot be requested via the FORMAT special requirement.
COS ACCUM, ALIGN, and ACQ Mode exposures may not use Internal targets.
COS ACCUM, TIME-TAG, and ACQ Mode exposures may not use target NONE.
COS ACQ/PEAKD Mode must have a STEP-SIZE optional parameter
STRIPE=LONG is not allowed with the G230L grating.
SEGMENT=B is restricted in COS/FUV ACQ/PEAKXD Mode.
STRIPE=SHORT is not allowed with the G230L grating and Wavelength = 2635.
STRIPE=MEDIUM is not allowed with the G230L grating and Wavelength = 3360.
SEGMENT=A is the default and only allowed value with the G140L grating and Wavelength = 1105.
SEGMENT=A is required with the G140L grating and Wavelength = 1230 for FP-POS=4 or ALL.
SEGMENT=B is not allowed for FUV target acquisition Modes for the G140L spectral element and Wavelength = 1230.
SEGMENT=B is Restricted for FUV target acquisition Modes for the G140L spectral element and Wavelength = 1280.
FLASH=YES is Restricted for FUV time-tag Mode for the G130M spectral element with Wavelength = 1055 or 1096 and op SEGMENT=B.
Wavelength=1230 is Available but Unsupported. It was made restricted beginning in cycle 18.
Cannot use Wavelengths 1055, 1096, or 1222 for ACQ Mode.
COS ALIGN Modes must specify NONE as the target.
FP-POS may only be specified on External Targets or Internal Target = WAVE or DEUTERIUM.
FP-POS may not be set to ALL on Internal Targets WAVE or DEUTERIUM.
FP-POS is restricted for use with the MIRRORs.
Aperture must be FCA for Target Name = DEUTERIUM
Calibration Target must be DEUTERIUM for Aperture FCA
Spectral Elements MIRRORA, MIRRORB are available for Engineering Only when Config = COS/NUV, Mode = TIME-TAG, Target = WAVE.
Only target NONE is allowed with config COS.
FLASH cannot be specified with FLASHEXP.
FLASH cannot be specified with FLASHCUR.
If FLASHCUR is specified, FLASHEXP must also be specified.
If FLASHEXP is specified, FLASHCUR must also be specified.
Internal targets with ACS must use ACCUM Mode.
DEUTERIUM can only be used with the HRC or SBC.
TUNGSTEN and BIAS can only be used with the HRC or WFC.
NONE can only be used with ACS ANNEAL and ALIGN Modes.
ACS ANNEAL and ALIGN Modes must use target NONE.
ACS BIAS must be given an exposure time of zero
ACS ACQ exposures must be less than 5 minutes in a GO proposal.
No optional parameters are allowed with the SBC.
On ACS/WFC, this value for the GAIN optional parameter is unsupported.
On ACS/HRC, the values of 1 and 8 for the GAIN optional parameter are unsupported.
A numerical value for FLASHEXP is only permitted for engineering proposals.
Aperture SBC must be specified if spectral element PR110L or PR130L is specified.
Aperture HRC must be specified if spectral element PR200L is specified.
CTE may only be used with DARK, TUNGSTEN, targets.
CTE may not be used with ACS/WFC subarray Apertures WFC1-512, WFC1-1K, WFC1-2K or WFC2-2K.
If CTE is specified as JCTWFS or JCTWE, AMP must be AD or BC.
CTE may not be used with ACS/HRC subarray Apertures HRC-512 or HRC-SUB1.8.
If CTE is specified as JCTHE, JCTHFS or JCTHFP then AMP must be A, B, C or D.
When a quadrant Aperture is specified, only the AMPs on the same WFC chip may be specified.
When a quadrant Aperture is specified, only the AMPs on the same WFC chip may be specified.
EARTH-CALIB and DARK-EARTH-CALIB are not allowed with the ACS/SBC configuration.
SIZEAXIS1 may not be specified if the Spectral Element specification includes F892N or a polarizer.
constraint.Explanation: When F892N or a polarizer is specified, STScI will automatically assign a subarray containing the entire FOV provided by those spectral elements. The subarray is approximately one quarter the size of the full WFC array. those subarray parameters may not be overridden.

constraint.Message: SIZEAXIS2 may not be specified if the Spectral Element specification includes F892N or a polarizer.
constraint.Explanation: When F892N or a polarizer is specified, STScI will automatically assign a subarray containing the entire FOV provided by those spectral elements. The subarray is approximately one quarter the size of the full WFC array. those subarray parameters may not be overridden.

constraint.Message: CENTERAXIS1 may not be specified if the Spectral Element specification includes F892N or a polarizer.
constraint.Explanation: When F892N or a polarizer is specified, STScI will automatically assign a subarray containing the entire FOV provided by those spectral elements. The subarray is approximately one quarter the size of the full WFC array. those subarray parameters may not be overridden.

constraint.Message: CENTERAXIS2 may not be specified if the Spectral Element specification includes F892N or a polarizer.
constraint.Explanation: When F892N or a polarizer is specified, STScI will automatically assign a subarray containing the entire FOV provided by those spectral elements. The subarray is approximately one quarter the size of the full WFC array. those subarray parameters may not be overridden.

constraint.Message: CTE may not be specified as JCTWFS or JCTWE if the Spectral Element specification includes F892N or a polarizer.
constraint.Explanation: When F892N or a polarizer is specified, STScI will automatically assign a subarray containing the entire FOV provided by those spectral elements. The subarray is approximately one quarter the size of the full WFC array. those subarray parameters may not be overridden.

constraint.Message: SIZEAXIS1 may not be specified if the Aperture is a Subarray Aperture.
SIZEAXIS2 may not be specified if the Aperture is a Subarray Aperture.
CENTERAXIS1 may only be specified if SIZEAXIS1 is specifed.
CENTERAXIS2 may only be specified if SIZEAXIS2 is specifed.
CENTERAXIS2 should be between 9 and 2039 inclusive or between 2057 and 4087 inclusive or TARGET.
CR-SPLIT may not be specified on Internal Targets. All internal target exposures will be taken as a single exposure with an implicit CR-SPLIT = NO
AUTOIMAGE may not be specified on Internal Targets.
FLASH, FLASHEXP and FLASHCUR may not be specified on Internal Target BIAS.
AUTOIMAGE may not be specified on Internal Target BIAS.
PAREXP may not be specified on Internal Targets BIAS, TUNGSTEN, or DEUTERIUM.
CTE may not be specified on Internal Targets BIAS or DEUTERIUM.
DEF is only allowed when ACS/WFC, ACS/HRC in ACCUM Mode and calibration target is DARK or BIAS
DEF is only allowed when ACS/SBC, in ACCUM Mode and calibration target is DARK
DEF is only allowed when ACS/WFC, ACS/HRC in ACCUM Mode and calibration target is DARK or BIAS
A filter must be crossed with a polarizer on the other wheel.
A filter must be crossed with a polarizer on the other wheel.
Only target NONE is allowed with config ACS.
